description: The day after Iran launched strikes against Israel, a senior Hamas official said that the group has been let down by its Arab neighbors after the Oct. 7 attacks.
title: Hamas feels supported by Iran after being 'disappointed' by other Middle Eastern countries

description: Israeli airstrikes and its ground invasion have forced dozens of Lebanese Christians to take shelter in a monastery close to the border with Israel.
title: Israeli airstrikes force Lebanese Christians to seek shelter in monastery

description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has vowed to respond to Iran's missile attack. Here's what the Israeli retaliation could be.
title: Israel has vowed Iran retaliation will be swift and 'painful' — but what would that look like?

description: Sameh Khadr Hassan Al-Asali, 38, had been staying in a Palestinian security forces compound in the occupied West Bank when he was killed by falling debris from an Iranian missile during Tuesday's attack on Israel.
title: Funeral held for Palestinian man killed by Iranian missile fragment in Jericho

description: Iran launched nearly 200 ballistic missiles into Israel, in what Iran said was a response to the killing of one of its commanders and Hezbollah leader, Hassan Nasrallah. The IDF said it intercepted most of the missiles fired. NBC News' Matt Bradley reports on the latest from the ground in the region, including Hezbollah announcing that it had exchanged fire with the Israelis.
title: Matt Bradley reports from Lebanon on what’s next after Iran fires missiles at Israel

description: Iran's attack on Israel has escalated an already tense situation in the Middle East, prompting fears of a regional war. NBC News chief international analyst and former supreme allied commander of NATO, Admiral James Stavridis, breaks down the chances of an all-out regional war in the Middle East.
title: Stavridis on war between Israel and Iran: 'We're not there yet'

description: Russian troops on Wednesday took charge of the eastern Ukrainian town of Vuhledar, a bastion that had resisted intense attacks since Russia launched its full-scale assault in 2022.
title: Russia captures strategic stronghold after 2 years of Ukrainian resistance

description: A North Korean defector living in South Korea was detained Tuesday after ramming a stolen bus into a barricade on a bridge near the heavily militarized border, in an apparent attempt to get back to the North.
title: North Korean defector steals bus in bid to return home from the South

description: Taiwan shut down on Wednesday ahead of the arrival of a weakening Typhoon Krathon, with one person reported dead and torrential rain lashing the island’s south.
title: Taiwan shuts down as Typhoon Krathon brings torrential rain

description: A regional airport in southwest Japan was closed on Wednesday after a U.S. bombshell that was likely dropped during World War II exploded near its runway.
title: Japan airport closed by explosion of U.S. bomb likely dating to World War II

description: The barrage of almost 200 missiles fired at Israel by Iran on Tuesday was largely thwarted, with no casualties reported in Israel. NBC News' Claudio Lavanga reports for Early Today on what led to the rapid escalation in violence.
title: Missile barrage on Israel was response to Hamas and Hezbollah assassinations, Iran says

description: Video shot from an apartment in nearby Herzliya shows an Iranian missile exploding in Tel Aviv after Israel’s Iron Dome defense system failed to intercept it.
title: Video shows explosion as Iranian missile hits Tel Aviv
